docs.snippet: Mirroring similar theatrical efforts, Berkeley Rep stages an adaptation of a Sinclair Lewis novel about a vain nominee inveighing against a religious minority....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mirroring similar theatrical efforts, Berkeley Rep stages an adaptation of a Sinclair Lewis novel about a vain nominee inveighing against a religious minority.
docs.abstract: Berkeley Repertory Theater begins previews of play It Can’t Happen Here, adapted from 1935 Sinclair Lewis novel and directed by Lisa Peterson, which eerily reflects political climate surrounding upcoming presidential election; list of other current plays and shows focusing on American presidential campaign highlighted.

headline.main: A Play Timed to Trump’s Candidacy Asks What If
headline.print_headline: In an Election Year, a Play Asks What If

docs.snippet: Carol Jones knows what she wants to hear Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump discuss during their first televised debate: education and jobs. She's far from sure which candidate will earn her vote on Election Day....

docs.snippet: With a tightly controlled state media, little access to outside information and a deeply instilled belief that whoever runs the White House is bound to be their sworn enemy, North Koreans aren't expecting much from the U.S. presidential elections ...
docs.lead_paragraph: With a tightly controlled state media, little access to outside information and a deeply instilled belief that whoever runs the White House is bound to be their sworn enemy, North Koreans aren't expecting much from the U.S. presidential elections — if they know about them at all.

headline.main: Donald Who? Most N. Koreans Don't Know, Care About US Polls
headline.print_headline: Donald Who? Most N. Koreans Don't Know, Care About US Polls

docs.snippet: News outlets and fact-checking sites can separate truth from fable after a debate, but it falls to the moderator to interject in the moment when a candidate lies....
docs.lead_paragraph: News outlets and fact-checking sites can separate truth from fable after a debate, but it falls to the moderator to interject in the moment when a candidate lies.
docs.abstract: Jim Rutenberg Mediator column calls for moderators of upcoming debate between presidential nominees to interject with truth when either Donald J Trump or Hillary Clinton makes obvious false statement; suggests this is perfect chance for journalists to redeem themselves after failing time after time to point out misinformation uttered during election campaign, allowing public to digest lies as fact.

headline.main: A Moment of Truth for Presidential Debate Moderators
headline.print_headline: A Moment  of Truth  for Debate  Moderators

byline.contributor: Research was contributed by Megan Thee-Brenan and Zachary Wichter.

docs.snippet: The regional votes have implications on whether the country’s four national parties can end the nine-month deadlock in Spain’s national politics....
docs.lead_paragraph: The regional votes have implications on whether the country’s four national parties can end the nine-month deadlock in Spain’s national politics.
docs.abstract: Spain’s main opposition Socialist Party is defeated by Popular Party in northwestern Galicia and Basque Nationalist Party in Basque region; results increase pressure on Socialist Party leader Pedro Sanchez to negotiate end to nine-month government deadlock.

headline.main: Socialist Party Sees Deep Losses in Spain Elections
headline.print_headline: Socialist Party Sees Deep Losses in Spain Elections
